p: We first analyzed the proximate compositions and amino acid profiles of the two MW meals (DMW-1 and DMW-2). The crude protein and crude lipid levels in DMW-1 and DMW-2 were similar to those of FM owing to the defatting process. MW contained all of the indispensable amino acids found in FM ( Table 3). The amino acid balance of MW was comparable to that of FM, and the indispensable amino acid levels in the control and test diets ( Table 1) were sufficient to meet the dietary requirement in red seabream [ 21]. However, the quantity of taurine was only 0.1 mg/g in MW compared to 1.5 mg/g in FM. Lack of dietary taurine results in green liver syndrome and growth retardation [ 22, 23, 24]; thus, taurine would need to be added as a supplement in test diets.
